components.name: Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction

provenance.textSnippet: Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction
provenance.rationale: This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.

components.name: Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature

provenance.textSnippet: Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work
provenance.rationale: This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.

components.name: Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours

provenance.textSnippet: Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours
provenance.rationale: This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.

components.name: Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours

provenance.textSnippet: Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours
provenance.rationale: This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.

components.name: Grade 4: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair

provenance.textSnippet: Grade 4: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair
provenance.rationale: This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.
This is an explicitly defined grade within the ECOG Performance Status scale provided in Appendix 2 of the protocol.

expansions.rationale: The protocol provides a full, explicit definition of the ECOG Performance Status scale, including descriptions for Grades 0 through 5, in Appendix 2 on page 100.

The individual tests for each panel are clearly enumerated in the `laboratory_tests` array, with provenance tracing back to Table 5 on page 48 of the protocol.

provenance.rationale: This test is explicitly listed as a component of the 'Coagulation' panel in the laboratory specifications, which directly corresponds to the 'aPTT, INR' activity.
This test is explicitly listed as a component of the 'Coagulation' panel in the laboratory specifications, which directly corresponds to the 'aPTT, INR' activity.

expansions.rationale: The extraction JSON, derived from Table 5 on page 48 of the protocol, explicitly defines a 'Coagulation' panel (PNL-004) containing two tests: 'Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT)' and 'International Normalized Ratio (INR)'. This directly decomposes the 'aPTT, INR' activity.

provenance.textSnippet: Conventional CT should be performed with cuts of 5 mm or less in slice thickness contiguously. This applies to tumors of the chest and abdomen.
provenance.rationale: This is explicitly defined as the preferred imaging modality for assessing tumors in the chest and abdomen.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: This is explicitly defined as the required imaging modality to assess for CNS involvement in symptomatic subjects.

expansions.rationale: The protocol and extraction data explicitly define the imaging modalities (CT of Chest/Abdomen, MRI/CT of Brain) used for Tumor Assessments. These are the distinct sub-components of the overall activity.

components.name: NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17

provenance.textSnippet: To assess the subject's health-related quality of life and symptoms, two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)...
provenance.rationale: This is one of the two specific questionnaires explicitly named in the protocol to assess the subject's health-related quality of life.

components.name: European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions 5 Level

provenance.textSnippet: ...and the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L).
provenance.rationale: This is one of the two specific questionnaires explicitly named in the protocol to assess the subject's health-related quality of life.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines that the 'QoL Questionnaires' activity consists of two specific instruments: NFLSI-17 and EQ-5D-5L. This is clearly stated on page 50 and captured in the extraction JSON.

provenance.textSnippet: One 4 mL whole blood sample for DNA isolation will be collected on C1D-2 from each subject who consents to provide a sample for pharmacogenetic analysis.
provenance.rationale: This is the specific type of specimen collected for the activity, as identified by its purpose description: 'Optional with Consent PG Blood Sampling Genetic (DNA)'.

provenance.textSnippet: One 4 mL whole blood sample for DNA isolation will be collected on C1D-2 from each subject who consents to provide a sample for pharmacogenetic analysis.
provenance.rationale: This is the explicit volume of whole blood required for the optional pharmacogenetic sample.

provenance.textSnippet: Whole Blood Frozen (as per the study specific laboratory manual)
provenance.rationale: This is the specified processing step for the whole blood sample collected for pharmacogenetic analysis, linked via the specimen reference 'SPEC-001'.

provenance.textSnippet: The samples will be retained while research on ABT-888 (or drugs of this class) continues but no longer than 20 years.
provenance.rationale: This is the maximum retention period explicitly defined for the collected DNA samples from the pharmacogenetic blood draw.

provenance.textSnippet: Samples will be shipped frozen to AbbVie or a designated laboratory for DNA extraction and long-term storage.
provenance.rationale: This is the required condition for shipping the pharmacogenetic samples to the designated laboratory.

expansions.rationale: The extraction JSON explicitly defines multiple components for the optional pharmacogenetic blood sample (SPEC-001), including the specimen type, volume, processing, storage, and shipping requirements. These details provide a comprehensive breakdown of the activity.

provenance.textSnippet: Subjects must consent to provide available archival tumor (biopsy preferred, or cytology) for analysis.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that the archival tumor tissue collected can be from a biopsy, which is the preferred source.

provenance.textSnippet: Subjects must consent to provide available archival tumor (biopsy preferred, or cytology) for analysis.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that the archival tumor tissue collected can be from a cytology sample as an alternative to biopsy.

expansions.rationale: The protocol specifies that the Tissue Sample Collection consists of providing archival tumor tissue, which can be sourced from either a biopsy (preferred) or a cytology sample, as detailed on page 52 and captured in the extraction JSON.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib will be determined using validated methods under the supervision of the Drug Analysis Department at AbbVie.
provenance.rationale: This is explicitly listed as the primary analyte to be measured from plasma samples for pharmacokinetic analysis.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be determined using validated or non-validated methods.
provenance.rationale: This is explicitly listed as a potential analyte to be measured from plasma samples for pharmacokinetic analysis.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines two analytes (veliparib and its metabolite(s)) for the Veliparib PK Sampling activity. This is clearly stated in the extraction JSON and confirmed on page 53 of the protocol PDF.

_agentDefinition.purpose: Decomposes composite SOA activities into their constituent components (e.g., 'Physical Exam including weight' -> separate PE and VS assessments), enabling granular scheduling and form assignment.
_agentDefinition.extractionMethodology: PDF-aware LLM analysis using Gemini File API to search protocol text for component details. Pattern recognition for common composite activities (PE+VS, Labs+UA, etc.). Parent-child relationship inference with confidence scoring.

keyOutputs.description: List of component activities derived from parent
Reference to the original composite activity

downstreamIntegrations.useCase: Granular form generation for each component
downstreamIntegrations.automationExample: Parent 'PE including weight' generates both PE Form and separate Weight field in VS Form
IRT visit checklist includes all expanded components for site guidance
Primary components scheduled first, secondary components follow

automationInsights.description: One SOA row may require multiple EDC forms when expanded
Component relationships enable workflow sequencing in site systems
Expanded components inform site resource and timing requirements
